companies.name: Tesla
companies.description: Tesla is pioneering humanoid robotics with Optimus, a general-purpose robot designed for manufacturing and household tasks. Leveraging Tesla's expertise in AI, autonomous systems, and manufacturing at scale.

robots.name: Optimus Gen 2
robots.tagline: A general-purpose humanoid robot designed for manufacturing, logistics, and everyday tasks, leveraging Tesla's AI and autonomous systems expertise.

features.title: Tesla AI Integration
features.description: Powered by the same AI stack that drives Tesla's Full Self-Driving technology, enabling real-time learning and adaptation.

features.title: Actuator Technology
features.description: Custom-designed actuators built for efficiency, durability, and precise control at scale.

videos.title: Optimus - Gen 2
videos.description: Tesla's second generation Optimus robot demonstration

companies.name: Figure AI
companies.description: Figure AI is building the world's first commercially viable autonomous humanoid robot. Figure 02 features advanced AI capabilities through partnership with OpenAI, designed for logistics and manufacturing applications.

robots.name: Figure 02
robots.tagline: The world's most advanced commercially viable humanoid robot, featuring OpenAI-powered conversational AI and autonomous task execution.

features.title: OpenAI Integration
features.description: Partnership with OpenAI enables natural language understanding and conversational interaction for intuitive human-robot collaboration.

features.title: Commercial Ready
features.description: Deployed at BMW manufacturing facilities, Figure 02 is designed for real-world industrial applications.

videos.title: Figure 02 - The Next Generation
videos.description: Introduction to Figure AI's second generation humanoid robot

companies.name: 1X Technologies
companies.description: 1X Technologies creates humanoid robots designed to work alongside humans. Their NEO robot is built for household and commercial applications, backed by OpenAI and featuring advanced embodied AI.

robots.name: NEO
robots.tagline: A human-scale bipedal robot designed for safe operation in homes and workplaces, featuring embodied AI for natural interaction.

features.title: Safe by Design
features.description: Built with soft, lightweight materials to operate safely alongside humans in homes and workplaces.

features.title: OpenAI Partnership
features.description: Backed by OpenAI's strategic investment, leveraging cutting-edge AI for embodied intelligence.

videos.title: Meet NEO
videos.description: Introduction to 1X Technologies' NEO humanoid robot for home assistance

companies.name: UBTECH
companies.description: UBTECH Robotics is a global leader in intelligent humanoid robots and AI education. Walker S2 is their flagship industrial humanoid, designed for manufacturing and service applications.

robots.name: Walker S2
robots.tagline: An industrial-grade humanoid robot designed for manufacturing and service applications with advanced dexterity and intelligence.

features.title: Industrial Ready
features.description: Deployed in automotive manufacturing facilities with NIO, demonstrating commercial viability in demanding industrial environments.

features.title: Advanced Manipulation
features.description: Features 41 degrees of freedom including highly dexterous hands for complex assembly and manipulation tasks.

videos.title: Walker S2 Mass Production
videos.description: UBTECH's Walker S2 humanoid robot mass production and delivery milestone

companies.name: Unitree Robotics
companies.description: Unitree Robotics specializes in high-performance humanoid and quadruped robots. The H1 humanoid features advanced locomotion and is one of the fastest humanoid robots available.

robots.name: H1
robots.tagline: The world's fastest bipedal humanoid robot, capable of running at 3.3 m/s with exceptional balance and agility.

features.title: World's Fastest
features.description: H1 holds the record for the fastest full-size bipedal humanoid robot, capable of running at speeds up to 3.3 m/s.

features.title: Affordable Innovation
features.description: Priced competitively starting at $90,000, making humanoid robotics more accessible for research and commercial applications.

robots.name: G1
robots.tagline: A compact and affordable humanoid robot designed for mass adoption in education, research, and light industrial applications.

features.title: Ultra Affordable
features.description: Starting at just $16,000, G1 democratizes access to humanoid robotics for researchers and developers.

features.title: Highly Dexterous
features.description: Features advanced hand manipulation with 11 DoF per hand for complex object handling.

videos.title: G1 Side Flip
videos.description: Unitree G1 performs world's first humanoid robot side flip

companies.name: Apptronik
companies.description: Apptronik is a leader in AI-powered humanoid robotics. Its humanoid robot, Apollo, is versatile and modular. Valued at $1.5 billion, Apptronik offers an attractive risk-reward profile with substantial upside potential.

robots.name: Apollo
robots.tagline: Apollo's human-like form allows it to navigate and operate efficiently in environments built for people, powered by advanced mobility and AI-driven interaction.

features.title: A modular robot
features.description: Its modular, versatile build supports swappable parts for task-specific optimization and deployment as bipedal, wheeled, or stationary units.

features.title: Powerful AI
features.description: Apollo partners with Google DeepMind for its brain, enabling advanced reasoning and task execution.

companies.name: Hyundai Motor
companies.description: Hyundai Motor Company owns Boston Dynamics and is investing heavily in robotics for future mobility solutions. Through Boston Dynamics, they develop the Atlas humanoid robot.

robots.name: Atlas (Boston Dynamics)
robots.tagline: Through ownership of Boston Dynamics, Hyundai has access to the world's most dynamic humanoid robot for future mobility and manufacturing applications.

features.title: Hyundai Ownership
features.description: Hyundai acquired Boston Dynamics in 2020, integrating advanced robotics into their future mobility strategy.

features.title: Electric Atlas
features.description: The new all-electric Atlas features a broader range of motion than any human, designed for real-world commercial applications.

companies.name: Boston Dynamics
companies.description: Boston Dynamics is a pioneer in advanced robotics, known for creating highly dynamic robots. Atlas is their flagship humanoid, capable of parkour-level athleticism and manipulation tasks.

robots.name: Atlas
robots.tagline: The world's most dynamic humanoid robot, capable of parkour, backflips, and complex manipulation tasks with unmatched agility.

features.title: Unmatched Agility
features.description: Atlas can perform parkour, backflips, and navigate complex terrain with human-like fluidity and balance.

features.title: Electric Evolution
features.description: The new all-electric Atlas features a broader range of motion than any human, designed for real-world commercial applications.

videos.title: Farewell to HD Atlas
videos.description: Boston Dynamics bids farewell to the hydraulic Atlas robot

companies.name: XPeng
companies.description: XPeng is a leading Chinese EV maker expanding into humanoid robotics. Their Iron robot is designed for manufacturing and logistics, leveraging their expertise in AI and autonomous systems.

robots.name: Iron
robots.tagline: A versatile humanoid robot designed for manufacturing and logistics, leveraging XPeng's expertise in AI and autonomous systems.

features.title: EV Expertise
features.description: Built on XPeng's electric vehicle technology, featuring efficient actuators and advanced battery management.

features.title: Factory Ready
features.description: Designed specifically for manufacturing environments with heavy payload capacity and precision manipulation.

companies.name: Xiaomi
companies.description: Xiaomi is a global technology company expanding into humanoid robotics with CyberOne. The robot features emotion recognition and advanced AI capabilities for future consumer applications.

robots.name: CyberOne
robots.tagline: A humanoid robot with advanced emotion recognition and natural interaction capabilities, designed for future consumer applications.

features.title: Emotion Recognition
features.description: Can detect and respond to human emotions through facial expression analysis and voice pattern recognition.

features.title: Consumer Focus
features.description: Designed with Xiaomi's consumer electronics expertise for future home companion applications.

companies.name: Neura Robotics
companies.description: Neura Robotics is a German company building cognitive humanoid robots. Their 4NE-1 robot combines advanced AI with human-like form for industrial and service applications.

robots.name: 4NE-1
robots.tagline: A cognitive humanoid robot combining advanced AI with human-like form for industrial and service applications across diverse environments.

features.title: Cognitive Intelligence
features.description: Features Neura's proprietary cognitive AI platform enabling understanding, reasoning, and adaptive task execution.

features.title: Human Collaboration
features.description: Designed for safe human-robot collaboration with advanced safety systems and intuitive interaction.

companies.name: Agility Robotics
companies.description: Agility Robotics builds Digit, a human-centric bipedal robot designed for logistics and warehouse operations. Partnered with Amazon for deployment in fulfillment centers.

robots.name: Digit
robots.tagline: A human-centric bipedal robot purpose-built for logistics operations, featuring advanced mobility and manipulation for warehouse environments.

features.title: Amazon Partnership
features.description: Deployed at Amazon fulfillment centers for testing, demonstrating commercial viability in high-volume logistics operations.

features.title: Exceptional Battery Life
features.description: Up to 16 hours of runtime enables full-shift operation without recharging, ideal for 24/7 warehouse operations.

videos.title: Digit at Work
videos.description: Agility Robotics Digit humanoid robot working at Amazon warehouses

companies.name: AgiBot
companies.description: AgiBot is a Chinese humanoid robotics startup developing the G1 general-purpose robot. Backed by major investors, they focus on embodied AI for industrial automation.

robots.name: Genie G1
robots.tagline: A general-purpose humanoid robot designed for embodied AI research and industrial automation applications.

features.title: Embodied AI Focus
features.description: Built from the ground up for embodied AI research with advanced learning capabilities and sensor integration.

features.title: Rapid Development
features.description: One of the fastest-growing humanoid robotics startups in China with strong investor backing.

companies.name: Fourier Intelligence
companies.description: Fourier Intelligence specializes in rehabilitation robotics and humanoid robots. The GR-2 is designed for healthcare, research, and commercial applications with a focus on affordability.

robots.name: GR-2
robots.tagline: An affordable humanoid robot designed for healthcare, research, and commercial applications with a focus on accessibility and versatility.

features.title: Healthcare Heritage
features.description: Built on Fourier's expertise in rehabilitation robotics, featuring precise and safe motion control for human interaction.

features.title: Research Accessible
features.description: Priced competitively for research institutions, with open APIs and ROS 2 compatibility for customization.

companies.name: Kepler Robotics
companies.description: Kepler Robotics is developing the Forerunner series of humanoid robots for industrial applications. Their K2 robot features advanced manipulation and mobility for factory environments.

robots.name: Forerunner K2
robots.tagline: An industrial humanoid robot optimized for manufacturing environments with advanced manipulation and mobility capabilities.

features.title: Heavy Payload
features.description: Industry-leading 40kg payload capacity enables handling of heavy components in manufacturing environments.

features.title: Extended Operation
features.description: 8-hour battery life supports full-shift operation for continuous industrial deployment.

companies.name: Sanctuary AI
companies.description: Sanctuary AI is building human-like intelligence in general-purpose robots. Their Phoenix robot features the Carbon AI system for human-level dexterity and reasoning.

robots.name: Phoenix
robots.tagline: A general-purpose humanoid robot powered by the Carbon AI system, designed to achieve human-level dexterity and cognitive abilities.

features.title: Carbon AI
features.description: Proprietary AI control system designed to replicate human-like intelligence and reasoning for general-purpose tasks.

features.title: Advanced Dexterity
features.description: Features industry-leading hand dexterity with haptic feedback for precise manipulation comparable to human hands.

videos.title: Gen 7 Phoenix
videos.description: Sanctuary AI's seventh generation Phoenix humanoid robot

companies.name: Honda
companies.description: Honda pioneered humanoid robotics with ASIMO, one of the first walking humanoid robots. While ASIMO is retired, Honda continues robotics R&D for mobility and assistance applications.

robots.name: ASIMO
robots.tagline: One of the world's first advanced humanoid robots, pioneering bipedal locomotion and human-robot interaction since 2000.

features.title: Pioneering Legacy
features.description: ASIMO was first unveiled in 2000 and retired in 2022, but its technology continues to influence Honda's robotics research.

features.title: Human Interaction
features.description: One of the first robots capable of recognizing moving objects, gestures, and sounds, enabling natural human interaction.

companies.name: Toyota
companies.description: Toyota develops humanoid robots through Toyota Research Institute. The T-HR3 is a telepresence humanoid robot designed for home assistance and disaster response applications.

robots.name: T-HR3
robots.tagline: A telepresence humanoid robot enabling remote physical presence through master-slave control for home assistance and disaster response.

features.title: Telepresence Control
features.description: Operators wear a Master Maneuvering System that maps their movements to T-HR3 in real-time with force feedback.

features.title: Toyota Research Institute
features.description: Developed by TRI as part of Toyota's vision for mobility and assistance robotics for aging populations.

companies.name: Samsung Electronics
companies.description: Samsung is developing AI-powered robots including Ballie, a rolling companion robot. They continue to invest in robotics R&D for smart home and industrial applications.

robots.name: Ballie
robots.tagline: A spherical AI companion robot designed for smart home management, featuring a built-in projector and advanced AI assistant capabilities.

features.title: Built-in Projector
features.description: Features a full HD projector that can display content on any surface, turning walls into smart displays.

features.title: Smart Home Hub
features.description: Integrates with Samsung SmartThings ecosystem to control all connected home devices through natural interaction.

companies.name: LG Electronics
companies.description: LG Electronics develops the CLOi series of service robots for hospitality and retail environments. They continue to expand their robotics portfolio for commercial applications.

robots.name: CLOi
robots.tagline: A versatile service robot series designed for hospitality, retail, and commercial environments with autonomous navigation and customer service capabilities.

features.title: Commercial Deployment
features.description: Deployed in hotels, airports, and retail stores worldwide for customer service, delivery, and information tasks.

features.title: Modular Design
features.description: Available in multiple variants including GuideBot, ServeBot, and DeliveryBot for different commercial applications.
